name: 勞維俊
objective: 本課程著重教導學生閱讀文章，並藉由文章訓練學生字彙建構、語言解析及聽力會話、思維啟發能力。課中延展活動將閱讀內容與聽力、會話、寫作做進一步的連結，並引導學生將所學做有效的應用。
schedule:
Department of English, Taipei Tech.

Title: Advanced English in Practice

Number of Credits: 2

Contact Hours Per Week: 3

Instructor: Louis Lo

Course Aims:

The course provides students with skill-based instructions in learning how to read literary and cultural texts. Desired learning outcomes include reading skill development, vocabulary building, language analysis, and critical thinking. Reading materials encompass a variety of viewpoints on global topics centered on social issues, the environment, psychology, business, and technology. Extended activities are designed to encourage students to go beyond the assigned materials, and to put what they have acquired from the readings into listening, speaking and writing practices.

Focus for Fall 2016: Life and Art

scorePolicy:
Teaching Approach:

Students are required to read all the assigned texts, including literary, filmic and theoretical works. They should attend lectures, participate in discussions in tutorials, take a mid-term examination, give a group presentation, and write an essay.
